definitions: (in the arts) the doctrine that the design of an object should be determined solely by its function, rather than by aesthetic considerations, and that anything practically designed will be inherently beautiful.
shortDefinitions: theory that design should be determined by function

definitions: (in the social sciences) the theory that all aspects of a society serve a function and are necessary for the survival of that society.
shortDefinitions: theory that all aspects of society have crucial function

definitions: (in the philosophy of mind) the theory that mental states can be sufficiently defined by their cause, their effect on other mental states, and their effect on behavior.
shortDefinitions: theory that mental states can be defined by their cause and effect
